clinical_study.brief_title: High-tech Acupuncture for Treatment of Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: High-tech Acupuncture for Treatment of Chronic Fatigue Syndrome - A Sino-Austrian Cooperation Randomized Controlled Trial(RCT) on Heart Rate Variability

lead_sponsor.agency: Hubei Provincial Collaborative Innovation Center of Preventive Treatment by Acupuncture and Moxibust

clinical_study.source: Hubei Provincial Collaborative Innovation Center of Preventive Treatment by Acupuncture and Moxibust

brief_summary.textblock:
1. To study the relationship between Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (CFS) and heart rate (HR) and its variability (HRV).
2. To compare the curative effects and the HR/HRV indices between applicationa of different acupoints as well as different treatments (acupuncture and moxibustion).

primary_outcome.description: In CFSS, symptoms of fatigue are assessed by scores ranging from 0 to 3.

secondary_outcome.description: NRC is a 10cm scale to assess the fatigue degree ranging from 0 to 10, the score of 0 stands for 'no fatigue' and 10 for 'serious'.

SF-36 consists of 36 items categorized as 8 dimensions: social functioning (2 items), role limitation-emotion (3 items), mental health (5 items), physical functioning (10 items), role limitation-physical (4 items), bodily pain (2 items), vitality (4 items), general health (5 items) and 1 question of health change in recent one year.
In DQSS, symptoms are assessed by scores ranging from 1 to 3, which stand for 'mild' to 'serious'.
